document.topic_text: Audubon Nature Center Events: September, 2016 August 11th, 2016 Contributed Article Audubon Nature Center Except as noted, events take place at the Audubon Nature Center, 1600 Riverside Road, Jamestown, New York, one-quarter mile east of Route 62 between Jamestown, New York, and Warren, Pennsylvania. To learn more, call (716) 569-2345 or visit www.jamestownaudubon.org . Friday, September 2, 2016, 11 a.m.-12 p.m., First Friday Lunch Bunch : Bill Evans, director of Old Bird Inc., on “Acoustic Monitoring of Bird Migration.” Nature Center provides coffee and tea for the BYO brown bag lunch that follows. $8, $6 for Friends of the Nature Center. Thursday, September 8, 2016, 6:30-9 p.m., Audubon Nature Photography Club: Camera tips and tricks, photo critique, guest speaker. $5 visitor fee can be applied toward $30 annual membership. To learn more, visit www.jasphotoclub.wordpress.com , call weekdays (716) 664-3707, or email . Saturday, September 10, 2016, 10-11:30 a.m., Little Explorers: “Hooked on Nature.”Children ages 3-8 and their favorite grownup enjoy a nature lesson, walk, craft, and a snack. $8; $6 Friends of the Nature Center. Reservations required by Thursday, September 8, 2016: Call (716) 569-2345 during business hours, or reserve online by clicking through “Little Explorers” at www.jamestownaudubon.org . Wednesday, September 14, 2016, 6-8 p.m ., Mushroom Mania: Dedicated mushroom hunter Garrett Taylor will teach you how to find and identify wild mushrooms, both edible and poisonous. $16, $12 Friends of the Nature Center . Paid reservations required by Saturday, September 10, 2016: Call (716) 569-2345 during business hours, or reserve online by clicking through “Mushroom Mania” at www.jamestownaudubon.org . Saturday, September 17, 2016, 10 a.m.-12 p.m., Seven “C’s” of Chautauqua County : Retired Jamestown Community College biology professor Tom Erlandson will talk about the seven waterways in Chautauqua County starting with “C” at this joint meeting of the Chautauqua County Historical Society and the Audubon Nature Center. Free thanks to the Chautauqua County Historical Society. Reservations are not required. Tuesday, Thursday, Friday, September 20, 22, 23, 2016, 9 a.m.-12:30 p.m., Adult Day Camp: Three mornings of learning, laughter, and exploration of life under the water in ponds, fall flowers, and all the amazing plants and animals on the Audubon property. $80, $60 Friends of the Nature Center. Paid reservations required by Friday, September 16, 2016: Stop by, c all (716) 569-2345 during business hours, or reserve online by clicking through “Adult Day Camp” at www.jamestownaudubon.org Wednesday, September 21, 2016, 10 a.m.-10:30 p.m., Elk Field Trip: Travel to the Elk County Visitor Center in Benezette, Pennsylvania, to see the Center, dine at the Benezette Hotel, and view herds of elk. $30; $20 Friends of the Nature Center. Limited enrollment. Paid reservations required by Friday, September 16, 2016: Call (716) 569-2345 during business hours, or reserve online by clicking through “Elk Field Trip” at www.jamestownaudubon.org . Sunday, September 25, 2016, 2-4 p.m., The Art of Bonsai for Beginners : Learn about the history of bonsai, the specialized tools used, and the most common styles of bonsai; all while creating your own bonsai tree. $56, $52 Friends of the Nature Center ; includes all materials. Limited enrollment. Paid reservations required by Monday, September 19, 2016: Call (716) 569-2345, or reserve online by clicking through “The Art of bonsai for Beginners” at www.jamestownaudubon.org . Monday, September 26, 2016, 5:30-8:30 p.m ., Volunteer Appreciation Night and Annual Dinner: A fun evening with a Big Announcement! $20 one dinner; $35 two dinners . Paid reservations required by Monday, September 19, 2016: Call (716) 569-2345, or reserve online by clicking through “Volunteer Appreciation Night and Annual Dinner” at www.jamestownaudubon.org . Next article
